Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Consumer Portfolio Services, Inc. (CPSS) Sell-Side Analysis Report

## Company Overview
Consumer Portfolio Services, Inc. (CPSS), founded in 1991 and headquartered in Las Vegas, Nevada, is a specialty finance company focused on indirect vehicle financing for subprime and non-prime borrowers. The company purchases retail installment sales contracts (RSCs) originated by franchised and independent auto dealers nationwide for new and used vehicles, primarily targeting customers with credit scores below 620. CPSS originates loans through a network of over 10,000 active dealers across 48 states, emphasizing a high-volume, low-cost model supported by proprietary underwriting software and advanced data analytics for credit risk assessment. 

As of Q2 2024 (ended June 30, 2024), CPSS managed a portfolio of approximately $2.33 billion in receivables, with a weighted average APR of 20.5% and an average FICO score of 535. The company securitizes ~90% of its portfolio through asset-backed securities (ABS) transactions, issuing 10-12 deals annually rated by agencies like S&P and Fitch. This structure allows efficient funding via the capital markets, with gains on sale recognized upfront. CPSS reported static pool net loss rates stabilizing at 10.2% for recent vintages, reflecting improved underwriting amid economic pressures. Revenue is driven by finance charges, servicing fees, and securitization gains, positioning CPSS as a niche player in the $1.2 trillion U.S. auto finance market, where subprime lending comprises ~20-25% of originations. (248 words)

**Current Stock Metrics** (as of October 10, 2024, via Yahoo Finance/Nasdaq):
- Stock Price: $9.78
- Market Capitalization: $392.4 million
- 52-Week Range: $7.80 - $13.22
- Trailing P/E: 4.78
- Dividend Yield: N/A

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (August 7, 2024)**: Revenues $110.2 million (down 6% YoY); Net income $10.5 million or $0.51/share (down 32% YoY); Portfolio gains $23.6 million. Contract purchases rose 18% YoY to $254 million, but delinquencies ticked up to 12.8% (30+ days).
- **Q3 2024 ABS Issuance (September 17, 2024)**: Priced $300 million senior ABS (CPS 2024-CPR2) at competitive spreads (200-500 bps over swaps), backed by $400 million pool with 11.4% projected loss rate.
- **Investor Discussions (StockTwits/Reddit, Sep-Oct 2024)**: Chatter focuses on recession risks pressuring subprime defaults; positive notes on ABS market access and share buybacks ($5M authorized in Q2).
- **Regulatory**: No major issues; filed 10-Q on August 7, 2024, highlighting stable funding costs.

## Growth Strategy
- Expand dealer network and digital origination tools for higher volume.
- Enhance AI-driven underwriting to target "super-prime subprime" (FICO 550-650) for lower losses.
- Maintain 10-12 ABS issuances/year; explore whole loan sales for diversification.
- Share repurchases: Repurchased 1.2 million shares YTD through Q2 2024.

## Company & Sector Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Strong ABS market access (13 consecutive deals); Improving static losses (down from 12% peaks); Dealer retention via competitive advances (85-115% of PV). | Rising delinquencies (12.8% in Q2 2024 vs. 11.9% Q1); High funding costs (5.5% warehouse rate). |
| **Sector (Subprime Auto Finance)** | Used car price stabilization (+2% YoY per Manheim Index, Sep 2024); Low unemployment (4.1%) supports borrowers. | Recession fears (Atlanta Fed GDPNow -2.1% Q3); Higher car insurance/repair costs; Charge-offs up 15% industry-wide (Fed data Q2 2024). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Core Offering**: Purchase of RSCs for used/new vehicles (avg. contract $25,000, 60-month term).
- **Securitization**: Monthly ABS deals ($200-400M each).
- **Servicing**: In-house for all loans, with skip-tracing and repossession capabilities.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- Piloting "CPS Direct" app for dealer uploads (beta Q3 2024, full rollout Q1 2025).
- Exploring EV financing guidelines amid rising used EV supply (mentioned in Q2 call).

## Market Share & Forecast
- **Current Market Share**: ~1-2% of U.S. subprime auto loan originations (~$250B annual market; CPSS volumes $1B+ annually). Leader in independent dealer channel (est. 5-7% share).
- **Forecast**: Modest growth to 2-3% by 2026 via volume expansion, but risk of decline to <1% if defaults exceed 13% (per Q2 call guidance). Analysts project 5-8% CAGR in managed receivables through 2025 (Seeking Alpha consensus).

## Competitor Comparison

| Metric | CPSS | Credit Acceptance (CACC) | DriveTime (DRVN private) | Westlake Financial (private) |
|--------|------|---------------------------|---------------------------|------------------------------|
| **Focus** | Subprime RSC purchases | Direct lending | Dealer-owned financing | Prime/subprime mix |
| **Portfolio Size** | $2.33B | $7.5B | $8B+ | $15B+ |
| **Avg FICO** | 535 | 525 | 540 | 650+ |
| **Recent Delinq.** | 12.8% | 13.5% | 11.2% | 8.5% |
| **P/E Ratio** | 4.78 | 12.5 | N/A | N/A |
| **Market Position** | Cost-efficient securitizer | Premium pricing | Vertically integrated | Broad spectrum |

CPSS trades at a discount to peers due to smaller scale/higher volatility but boasts superior ROE (25% TTM).

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: Dealer network (10,000+); ABS underwriters (Keefe Bruyette, Drexel); Rating agencies (S&P, Fitch).
- **M&A**: None recent; 2021 acquired small servicing platform (undisclosed).
- **Major Clients**: No concentration (>100 dealers <1% volume); Potential: Expanding with Carvana-like platforms for used inventory financing (discussions noted in Q2 call).
- **Other Qualitative**: High insider ownership (15%); ESG neutral (no major issues); Experienced mgmt (CEO Charles Bradley 30+ yrs).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: 6/10 (Hold). Attractive valuation (0.17x sales) with 20% upside potential from ABS stability, but subprime cyclicality warrants caution for moderate risk/growth appetite. Avoid if recession deepens.
- **Fair Value Estimate**: $11.80 (20% upside from $9.78). Based on 1.0x 2025E book value ($11.50/share per Q2 trends) + 10% premium for execution; DCF implies $12-13 assuming 7% rev CAGR, 12% losses. (Consensus targets ~$12 from Zacks/Seeking Alpha, Oct 2024). 

*Sources: CPSS Q2 2024 10-Q/earnings call (SEC, Aug 7, 2024); Yahoo Finance/Nasdaq (Oct 10, 2024); Seeking Alpha transcripts; Bloomberg ABS data; Reddit/StockTwits sentiment (Sep-Oct 2024). All quantitative data <6 months old.*
